intro: Chrysanthemum alpinum f. cuneifolium, commonly known as the alpine chamomile, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrowly lance-shaped, giving it the common name "cuneifolium," which refers to its leaf morphology. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its aromatic properties.
